bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, June 23, 1914

div1.p: Carter reports that he is half-way finished with his public health work in South Carolina.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, June 23, 1914
div1.opener:
JEFFERSON
HOTEL
W. H. PLUMMER, MANAGER
ABSOLUTELY FIRE-PROOF
150 ROOMS - EVERY ROOM WITH BATH.
JNO. J. CAIN, PRESIDENT
COLUMBIA, S. C. June 23 1914
My Dear Laura:
div1.p:
Just a note this time: It is
after breakfast (7.30) & before work.
We had a very hot & fatiguing
day yesterday but I judge about 1/2
finished our work here. Today we
will not make an early start, as I
have to see a couple of Health Officers
who are not visible until 9 O'clock

That prevents us from work in this
early part of the day. which is a
nuisance.

The nights are very hot here, but I
2
judge that they are hot every
where in the U. S..

Here come the others & I will have
to stop. Keep on getting better. Do you
hear
Give my love to the others
